info.title: Roulette API
info.description:
The Roulette API provides programmatic access to manage your VC deal flow,
companies, contacts, and related data.

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication using a Bearer token. Include your API key
in the `Authorization` header:

```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

You can generate API keys from your account settings in the Roulette dashboard.

## Rate Limiting

API requests are rate limited to ensure fair usage. Current limits:
- 1000 requests per minute per API key
- 100 requests per second per API key

Rate limit headers are included in all responses:
- `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Maximum requests per window
- `X-RateLimit-Remaining`: Requests remaining in current window
- `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Unix timestamp when the window resets

## Pagination

List endpoints support cursor-based pagination using the following query parameters:
- `page`: Page number (default: 1)
- `limit`: Items per page (default: 25, max: 100)

Paginated responses include pagination metadata:
```json
{
  "data": [...],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 25,
    "has_next": true,
    "has_prev": false
  }
}
```

**Note**: For performance reasons, total counts (`total`, `total_pages`) are not included.
Use `has_next` and `has_prev` to determine if more pages exist.

## Errors

The API uses standard HTTP status codes and returns errors in a consistent format:

```json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Human readable error message",
  "data": null
}
```

Common status codes:
- `400` Bad Request - Invalid parameters or request body
- `401` Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key
- `403` Forbidden - Valid API key but insufficient permissions
- `404` Not Found - Resource not found
- `429` Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded
- `500` Internal Server Error - Server-side error

tags.name: Companies
tags.description:
Manage companies in your deal flow pipeline. Companies represent potential
investment opportunities with associated pitch decks, contacts, and metadata.

tags.name: Company Statuses
tags.description:
Manage deal flow stages/statuses for organizing companies through your
investment pipeline (e.g., "Initial Review", "Due Diligence", "Closed").

tags.name: Company Settings
tags.description: Configure custom fields and settings for company tracking.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description:
Manage contacts associated with companies, including founders, executives,
and other key personnel.

tags.name: Form Submissions
tags.description: Access form submissions from integrated platforms like Tally.

tags.name: Emails
tags.description: Manage emails linked to companies and contacts.

tags.name: Meeting Minutes
tags.description: Store and retrieve meeting notes and minutes related to companies.

tags.name: Shared Links
tags.description: Create and manage secure shareable links for company portfolios.

tags.name: Investor Dashboard
tags.description: Configure and manage investor-facing portfolio dashboards.

tags.name: Dashboard
tags.description: Access aggregated dashboard data and analytics.

tags.name: Team Members
tags.description: View team members and their roles within your account.

tags.name: Short URLs
tags.description: Create shortened URLs with optional password protection.

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of companies in your deal flow pipeline.
Supports filtering, sorting, and full-text search.

**Note**: Pagination uses cursor-based `has_next`/`has_prev` for performance.
Total counts are not provided to optimize response times.

parameters.name: company_status_id
parameters.description: Filter by status ID. Use 'no_status' for companies without a status.

parameters.name: include_pdf_url
parameters.description: Include signed download URLs for pitch deck PDFs

metadata.ai_analysis: B2B SaaS platform for enterprise workflow automation...

post.description:
**The recommended way to create companies in Roulette.**

This intelligent endpoint accepts unstructured text (emails, notes, form data) and
file attachments, then uses AI to automatically:

1. **Extract URLs** from text using regex (handles long signed URLs from DocSend, Tally, etc.)
2. **Prioritize deck sources** by known platforms (DocSend, Papermark, Brieflink, Google Drive)
3. **Select the best pitch deck** from URLs or files
4. **Auto-detect company status** based on content context
5. **Auto-detect source** (email, referral, form, etc.) from content
6. **Upload remaining files** as attachments

## How It Works

### URL Priority (Highest â†’ Lowest)
1. DocSend links
2. Papermark links
3. Brieflink links
4. Tally storage URLs
5. Google Drive links
6. Other URLs

### File Processing Logic
- **Single file**: Always treated as the pitch deck (regardless of type)
- **Multiple files**: AI analyzes PDF content to select the best deck candidate
- **Fallback**: First PDF file if AI can't determine

### Context Analysis
When text content is provided (>50 chars), the AI analyzes it to:
- Detect appropriate pipeline status based on conversation context
- Identify the source (email forward, referral mention, etc.)

## Use Cases

- **Email forwarding**: Paste the full email body + attachments
- **Form submissions**: Send form data as text + any uploaded files
- **Manual entry**: Provide company info + deck URL or file
- **Bulk import**: Process founder outreach emails automatically

value.text:
From: founder@startup.com
Subject: Intro - TechCo Series A

Hi, I'm the founder of TechCo. We're building AI tools for developers.
Here's our deck: https://docsend.com/view/abc123

We're currently raising a $5M Series A.
Meeting notes from coffee chat with Jane from StartupXYZ
value.name: StartupXYZ

200.description: Company created successfully with AI analysis

analysis.aiReasoning: Selected DocSend URL as primary deck source (high priority platform)

contextAnalysis.statusReasoning: Email mentions 'Series A raise' - assigned to fundraising stage
contextAnalysis.sourceReasoning: Content appears to be a forwarded email from founder

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific company.

parameters.name: include_pdf_url
parameters.description: Include signed download URL for pitch deck PDF

patch.description: Update company information. Only include fields you want to change.

delete.description:
Permanently delete a company and all associated data including
attachments, notes, and shared access records.

post.description:
Use AI to analyze the company's pitch deck and extract structured data
including company information, founder details, and key insights.

The analysis populates:
- `metadata.founders` - Team member information
- `metadata.ai_analysis` - Brief company description
- `metadata.analyzed_at` - When analysis was performed
- `metadata.user_preferences` - Extracted custom field values

**Note**: This operation consumes AI credits.

extraData.description:
Additional text context to include in the analysis.
Can contain supplementary information like email threads,
meeting notes, or other relevant content that helps the AI
better understand the company.

get.description:
Generate a signed download URL for the company's pitch deck PDF.
URLs are temporary and expire after the specified duration.

parameters.name: expiry_minutes
parameters.description: URL expiry time in minutes (default varies by plan)

download_url.description: Signed URL for downloading the PDF

post.description:
Upload additional documents/attachments to a company
(financials, legal docs, etc.).

get.description:
Retrieve all deal flow statuses/stages for an account.
Results are ordered by rank (pipeline order), then by creation date.

post.description:
Create a new deal flow status/stage. If rank is not provided,
the status is added at the end of the pipeline.

patch.description: Update the name, color, rank, or other properties of a status.

delete.description:
Delete a deal flow status. Companies with this status will have
their status set to null.

get.description:
Retrieve pre-computed counts of companies grouped by their deal flow status.
Useful for dashboard displays and pipeline visualization.

Retrieve custom field configurations for companies in this account.
These define additional metadata fields that can be tracked.

options.description: For select fields, the available options

get.description:
Retrieve aggregated dashboard data including statistics,
pipeline summary, recent activity, and charts.

This endpoint is optimized for performance and returns
pre-computed metrics where possible.

parameters.name: activity_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of recent activity items to return

parameters.name: chart_days
parameters.description: Number of days to include in chart data

recent_activity.description: TechStartup Inc was added to pipeline
AI Platform moved to Due Diligence

get.description: Retrieve all members and pending invitations for the account/team.

post.description:
Create a checkout session to purchase additional AI credits
for features like pitch deck analysis and email processing.

credits_package.description:
Credit package to purchase:
- `starter`: 100 credits
- `professional`: 500 credits
- `enterprise`: 2000 credits

success_url.description: URL to redirect after successful payment

cancel_url.description: URL to redirect if payment is cancelled

checkout_url.description: URL to redirect user to for payment

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Filter emails linked to a specific company

emails.subject: Investment Opportunity - AI Platform
emails.content_preview: Hi, I wanted to reach out about our Series A...

post.description:
Manually create an email record. Useful for importing emails
from external sources or syncing from email integrations.

example.subject: Introduction - NewStartup seeking Series A
example.content:
Hi,

I'm the founder of NewStartup, and I wanted to reach out...

get.description: Retrieve a specific email with full content and attachments.

patch.description: Update email properties like tags, processed status, or linked companies.

delete.description: Permanently delete an email and its attachments.

get.description: Get all attachments for an email with download URLs.
Get all tags used in emails for this account, with usage counts.

post.description:
Use AI to analyze email content and extract structured information
such as company details, contact info, and intent classification.

**Note**: This operation consumes AI credits.
Associate an email with one or more companies.

get.description:
Retrieve paginated form submissions from integrated platforms
(Tally, Specter, etc.) or manually created submissions.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Filter submissions linked to a specific company

post.description:
Manually create a form submission record. Useful for importing
data from external sources or creating test data.

get.description: Retrieve a specific form submission with all field data.

patch.description:
Update a form submission. Commonly used to mark as processed
or link to a company.

post.description:
Create a new company from a form submission, automatically
mapping form fields to company properties.

field_mapping.description: Custom field mapping (form field key -> company field)

company_status_id.description: Initial status for the new company

get.description:
Retrieve all configured integrations for an account.
Integration secrets/keys are never returned in responses.

post.description:
Configure a new integration or update an existing one.
If an integration of the specified type already exists, it will be updated.

## Tally Integration

Tally forms can send webhooks to Roulette when submissions are received.
Provide the signing secret from your Tally webhook settings.

Webhook URL: `https://www.useroulette.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}/form-submissions/tally`

## Specter Integration

Connect to Specter for additional data enrichment.
Provide your Specter API key.

get.description:
Retrieve details about a specific integration.
Secrets/keys are never returned.

patch.description: Update integration settings including credentials and active status.

delete.description:
Remove an integration and its stored credentials.
This will stop any webhooks or data syncing from this integration.

post.description:
Test that the integration is properly configured and can connect
to the external service.

get.description:
Retrieve the investor dashboard configuration for an account.
The investor dashboard is a public-facing page that can be shared
with LPs to show portfolio performance and updates.

post.description:
Create an investor dashboard for the account. Only one dashboard
can exist per account.

400.description: Dashboard already exists or invalid request

patch.description:
Update investor dashboard settings including password,
permissions, and active status.

delete.description:
Delete the investor dashboard. The dashboard URL will immediately
stop working.

get.description:
Retrieve access logs showing who viewed the investor dashboard,
when, and from where.
Retrieve paginated meeting minutes/notes associated with your account.

post.description:
Create a new meeting minutes record. Supports markdown formatting
in the content field.

example.title: Due Diligence Call - AI Platform
example.content:
## Summary
Deep dive into technical architecture and team background.

## Key Takeaways
- Strong technical team with ML expertise
- Clear product-market fit in enterprise segment
- Requesting $5M Series A

## Next Steps
- Schedule follow-up with CTO
- Request customer references

get.description: Retrieve a specific meeting minutes record with full content.

patch.description: Update meeting minutes content or metadata.

delete.description: Permanently delete a meeting minutes record.

get.description:
Retrieve all shared links for an account. Shared links allow you to
share company portfolios with external parties (LPs, co-investors, etc.)
with granular access control.

post.description:
Create a new shared link with selected companies. You can configure
password protection, expiration, and per-company access permissions.

example.name: Series A Portfolio for ABC Capital
example.description: Selection of our top Series A companies for review

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a shared link including
the list of included companies and their permissions.

patch.description:
Update shared link properties including name, password, expiration,
active status, and the list of included companies.

delete.description:
Permanently delete a shared link. The link will immediately
stop working and cannot be recovered.

get.description:
Retrieve access logs for a shared link showing who viewed it,
when, and from where.

post.description:
Create a shortened URL with optional password protection and expiration.
Useful for tracking link clicks and sharing protected content.

password.description:
Optional password protection:
- Provide a password string for custom password
- Use "auto-generate" to generate a random password
- Omit or set to null for no password

metadata.description: Custom metadata to attach to the URL

password.description:
The password for the URL (only returned when auto-generated).
Store this - it won't be returned again.

get.description:
Resolve a short code to its original URL. If the URL is password
protected, the correct password must be provided.

400.description: Invalid short code or missing password

404.description: Short URL not found or expired

BearerAuth.description:
API key authentication. Generate keys from your account settings.

Include in header: `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY`

CursorPagination.description:
Cursor-based pagination for optimal performance.
Does not include total counts to avoid expensive database queries.

has_next.description: Whether there are more results after this page

has_prev.description: Whether there are results before this page

rank.description: Position in pipeline. If not provided, added at the end.

deck_link.description: URL to the pitch deck (external link or storage URL)

deck_storage_path.description: Internal storage path for uploaded pitch deck

visibility.description:
Visibility level:
- `private`: Only visible to the creator
- `shared`: Visible to specific users via company_shared_access
- `team`: Visible to all team members

source.description: How the company was added to the pipeline

source_content.description:
Raw source content when company was created from a form submission.
Contains the original form field data in a serialized format.

notes.description: Internal notes about the company (not visible to the company)
notes.example: Met at TechCrunch Disrupt. Strong technical team.

assignees.description: List of team members assigned to this company

created_by.description: User ID who created this company record

updated_by.description: User ID who last updated this company record

updated_at.description: When the company was last updated

CompanyMetadata.description:
Custom metadata for the company. Contains AI-extracted data, founder info,
and user-configurable custom fields.

founders.description: Founder/team member information (typically AI-extracted from pitch deck)

ai_analysis.example: B2B SaaS platform providing enterprise workflow automation with AI-powered document processing.

analyzed_at.description: When the AI analysis was performed

user_preferences.description: Custom fields configured by the account for tracking company data

Founder.description: Information about a company founder or team member

background.example: Former engineer at Google, 10 years in enterprise software

UserPreference.description:
Custom field for tracking company data. Supports multiple field types:
- `text`: Free-form text input
- `boolean`: True/false toggle
- `select`: Single selection from predefined options

value.description: Current value (type depends on field type)

show_in_table.description: Whether this field is displayed in the companies table view

Assignee.description: Team member assigned to a company

CompanyUpdate.description: All fields are optional for partial updates

authType.description: Authentication method used for this request

pdf_download_url.description: Signed URL for downloading the pitch deck PDF (if requested)

CompanyAttachment.description: File or link attachment associated with a company

attachment_type.description: Type of attachment (file stored in storage, or external link)

file_path.description: Storage path for file attachments (null for links)

link_url.description: External URL for link attachments (null for files)

file_mime_type.description: MIME type of the file (files only)

data.description: Analysis results extracted from the pitch deck

company_name.description: Company name extracted from the deck (if detected)

ai_analysis.example: B2B SaaS platform providing enterprise workflow automation with AI-powered document processing.

founders.description: Founder/team information extracted from the deck

user_preferences.description: Custom field values extracted based on account's configured fields

text.description:
Unstructured text content to process. Can include:
- Full email body (with headers)
- Form submission data
- Meeting notes
- URLs to pitch decks (DocSend, Google Drive, etc.)

The AI will extract URLs and analyze context to determine
company status and source automatically.
text.example:
From: founder@startup.com
Subject: TechCo - Series A Deck

Hi, here's our pitch deck: https://docsend.com/view/abc123

We're raising $5M at a $20M pre-money valuation.

account_id.description: Account/team ID to create the company under

name.description:
Optional company name override. If not provided, the AI
will attempt to extract it from the text or deck.

visibility.description: Visibility level for the new company

company_status_id.description:
Optional status override. If not provided, the AI will
attempt to detect an appropriate status from the content.

source.description:
Optional source override. If not provided, the AI will
attempt to detect the source from content context.

metadata.description: Optional custom metadata to merge with AI-extracted data

file_0.description: First file attachment (pitch deck or supporting document)

file_3.description: Fourth file attachment (up to 10 files supported via file_N pattern)

pdfDownloadUrl.description:
Signed URL for downloading the pitch deck PDF.
Only present if a deck was successfully processed and stored.

attachments.description: List of additional files uploaded as attachments

UploadedAttachment.description: An attachment uploaded during AI company creation

AiAnalysisResult.description: Details about the AI processing that occurred

detectedUrls.description:
All URLs extracted from the text content using regex.
Includes signed URLs, short links, and deck platform URLs.

selectedDeckUrl.description:
The URL that was selected as the primary pitch deck source.
Only present if a URL was used (vs. uploaded file).

selectedDeckFile.description:
Name of the file that was selected as the primary pitch deck.
Only present if an uploaded file was used (vs. URL).

aiReasoning.description:
Explanation of why the AI selected the particular deck source.
Useful for debugging and understanding the selection logic.
aiReasoning.example: Selected DocSend URL as primary deck source (high priority platform)

contextAnalysis.description: Results of AI context analysis on the text content

statusDetected.description: Whether a company status was auto-detected

statusReasoning.example: Email mentions 'Series A raise' - assigned to fundraising stage

sourceReasoning.example: Content appears to be a forwarded email from founder

content.description:
Email body content. Note: This field is excluded from list queries
for performance. Use the get single email endpoint for full content.

content_preview.description: Truncated preview of the email content

processed.description: Whether this email has been processed/reviewed

count.description: Number of emails with this tag

integration_type.description: Source integration that created this submission

data.description:
Form field data. Structure varies by form/integration.
Typically contains an array of field objects with key, label, type, and value.

processed.description: Whether this submission has been processed/reviewed

is_active.description: Whether the integration is currently active

last_sync_at.description: When data was last synced from this integration

secret.description:
For Tally: The webhook signing secret.
Required when integration_type is 'tally'.

api_key.description:
For Specter: The API key.
Required when integration_type is 'specter'.

is_active.description: Whether the dashboard is publicly accessible

password_protected.description: Whether a password is required to access

short_code.description: Unique code for the dashboard URL

dashboard_url.description: Full URL for the investor dashboard

shared_permissions.description:
What information is shared on the dashboard:
- `view_portfolio`: List of portfolio companies
- `view_metrics`: Performance metrics and charts
- `view_updates`: Company updates and news
- `download_reports`: Ability to download reports

last_accessed_at.description: When the dashboard was last viewed

password.description: Set to null to remove password protection

id.description: Unique identifier for the meeting minutes

content.example:
## Attendees
- John Doe (Founder)
- Jane Smith (VC Partner)

## Discussion Points
- Product roadmap overview
- Current traction metrics
- Funding requirements

processed.description: Whether these minutes have been processed/reviewed

created_at.description: When the user joined the team

invited_by.description: User ID of who sent the invitation

id.description: Unique identifier for the shared link

name.description: Internal name for the shared link

short_code.description: Unique short code for the URL

password_protected.description: Whether a password is required to access

is_active.description: Whether the link is currently active

companies.description: Companies included in this shared link

view_count.description: Number of times the link has been accessed

permissions.description:
Access level for this company:
- `view`: Basic company info only
- `view_deck`: Info + pitch deck
- `full`: All available information

name.description: Internal name for the shared link

password.description: Set to null to remove password protection

AccountIdParam.name: account_id
AccountIdParam.description: The unique identifier of the account/team

CompanyIdParam.name: id
CompanyIdParam.description: The unique identifier of the company

BadRequestError.description: Bad request - invalid parameters or request body

UnauthorizedError.description: Unauthorized - missing or invalid API key

example.error: You do not have permission to access this resource
